name: Blob Track CHOP
description: The Blob Track CHOP allows tracking blobs in 2D point data.
summary: The Blob Track CHOP allows tracking blobs in 2D point data.

parameters.name: Active
parameters.label: Active
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Blob Track  allows tracking blobs in 2D point data.
Input data should be have two channels named tx and ty describing the 2D points in cartesian coordinates. See the OP Snippets examples.
Good sources for input scans are the Hokuyo CHOP (in Cartesian coordinate mode) and the Leuze ROD4 CHOP. These devices naturally output a radial scan from the device as the center point, where each point represents (angle, distance). Outputting each scan point in Cartesian coordinate mode gives an (x,y) for each point which is the format required for the Blob Track .  
But any set of (x,y) points in the two channels will be analyzed.  The tracker looks for consecutive points close to each other, and handles the case where one blob passes behind another blob giving the hidden blob a linear motion for a specifiable amount of time while it occluded before it removes the blob from the set of blobs being output.
See also Blob Track TOP
blobtrackCHOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  active - While on, the  receives information from the input. While off, no processing occurs. Existing blobs will remain.



  searchmode -  - Controls how searching for blobs is done across all the points.

 all - All the points are compared against each other to find blobs. This mode is slower but more robust for data that has the points randomly assorted in the . consecutive - Points are only compared against points in neighbouring samples of the  data to find blobs. This is much faster but the data much be setup such that points that are close to each other in space are next to each other in the  samples. Data coming from devices such as the Hokuyo CHOP and Leuze ROD4 CHOP output data in this format.

  maxblobs - The maximum number of blobs that can be tracked.



  maxpointdistance - Two measured points from the input are considered to be part of the same blob if they are this distance or closer to each other.



  maxblobmovement - This controls the maximum distance a blob can move between successive frames and still be considered the same 'blob'.



  areaofinterest -  - Limits the area in which blobs are tracked. Points outside the area of interest are ignored.

 off - No limitations, blobs tracked throughout the scanned area. rectangle - Blobs only tracked within specified rectangle. circle - Blobs only tracked within specified circle (or ellipse).

  center -  - The center of the area of interest.

 centerx - centery -

  size -  - The size of the area of interest.

 sizew - sizeh -

  rotate - Rotate the area of interest.



  allowmovementoutside - When this is on, blobs detected within the Area of Interest can move outside of that area and still be tracked. When this is off blobs that move outside the area of interest will stop being tracked.





  outputcentroid - Include the centroid of detected blobs as part of the output channels.



  outputvelocity - Include the velocity of detected blobs as part of the output channels.



  minblobpoints - Minimum number of points that must be near each other to form a blob. Use to help filter out false positives.



  blobinittime - Amount of time a blob must be detected to be considered trustworthy. Use to help filter out false positives. A blob will only be output if it's been detected for at least time amount of time.



  lostblobtimeout - The amount of time before a blob that has been lost is removed from the output.



  predicttype -  - With prediction enabled, blobs from the last frame have their new position predicted before being matched to the current frame.

 off - Blobs are matched against the blob positions from the last frame. simple - Prediction uses constant velocity assumption; blobs are moved the same distance that they moved last frame. kalman - Prediction uses kalman filtering, with a constant velocity model, to move the blobs forward from last frame.



  timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.



  scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.



  srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





 -


Extra Information for the Blob Track  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.


 -
 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nmw-replace2022.241402021.100002020.23680before 2020.23680
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



Each SOP has a list of Points. Each point has an XYZ 3D position value plus other optional attributes. Each polygon Primitive is defined by a vertex list, which is list of point numbers.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.

 centerx - centery -

parameters.name: Center
parameters.label: Center
parameters.description: centerx - centery -

parameters.name: Size
parameters.label: Size
parameters.description:
size -  - The size of the area of interest.

 sizew - sizeh -

parameters.name: Size
parameters.label: Size
parameters.description: sizew - sizeh -

parameters.name: Rotate
parameters.label: Rotate
parameters.description: rotate - Rotate the area of interest.

parameters.name: Allow Movement Outside Area
parameters.label: Allow Movement Outside Area
parameters.description: allowmovementoutside - When this is on, blobs detected within the Area of Interest can move outside of that area and still be tracked. When this is off blobs that move outside the area of interest will stop being tracked.

parameters.name: Output Centroid
parameters.label: Output Centroid
parameters.description: outputcentroid - Include the centroid of detected blobs as part of the output channels.

parameters.name: Output Velocity
parameters.label: Output Velocity
parameters.description: outputvelocity - Include the velocity of detected blobs as part of the output channels.

parameters.name: Min Points per Blob
parameters.label: Min Points per Blob
parameters.description: minblobpoints - Minimum number of points that must be near each other to form a blob. Use to help filter out false positives.

parameters.name: Blob Init Time (s)
parameters.label: Blob Init Time (s)
parameters.description: blobinittime - Amount of time a blob must be detected to be considered trustworthy. Use to help filter out false positives. A blob will only be output if it's been detected for at least time amount of time.

parameters.name: Lost Blob Timeout (s)
parameters.label: Lost Blob Timeout (s)
parameters.description: lostblobtimeout - The amount of time before a blob that has been lost is removed from the output.

parameters.name: Blob Movement Prediction Type
parameters.label: Blob Movement Prediction Type
parameters.description:
predicttype -  - With prediction enabled, blobs from the last frame have their new position predicted before being matched to the current frame.

 off - Blobs are matched against the blob positions from the last frame. simple - Prediction uses constant velocity assumption; blobs are moved the same distance that they moved last frame. kalman - Prediction uses kalman filtering, with a constant velocity model, to move the blobs forward from last frame.

parameters.name: Off
parameters.label: Off
parameters.description: off - Blobs are matched against the blob positions from the last frame. simple - Prediction uses constant velocity assumption; blobs are moved the same distance that they moved last frame. kalman - Prediction uses kalman filtering, with a constant velocity model, to move the blobs forward from last frame.

parameters.name: Time Slice
parameters.label: Time Slice
parameters.description: timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.label: Scope
parameters.description: scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.

parameters.name: Sample Rate Match
parameters.label: Sample Rate Match
parameters.description:
srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.label: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.description: first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Export Method
parameters.label: Export Method
parameters.description:
exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: DAT Table by Index
parameters.label: DAT Table by Index
parameters.description: datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: Export Root
parameters.label: Export Root
parameters.description: autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.

parameters.name: Export Table
parameters.label: Export Table
parameters.description: exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).
